titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Washington State Normal School Accounting Office, General Property Ledger 1918-1928

did.unittitle: Washington State Normal School Accounting Office, General Property Ledger
did.abstract: The general property ledger of the Washington State Normal School (presently Central Washington University) Accounting Office documents the costs of managing school grounds, 1918 to 1928.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Accounting Office at Washington State Normal School was established in 1917 as a duty assigned to the head of the Department of Business Education. A full-time accountant was hired by the school in 1924. The Accounting Office has continued to manage the university’s finances since that date and is currently known as the Accounting Department.

scopecontent.p: The general property ledger of the Washington State Normal School (presently Central Washington University) Accounting Office contains descriptions of land purchases, item inventories of campus buildings, costs of construction and repairs to campus buildings and grounds, and itemized lists of purchases by the office and department from 1918 to 1928.

odd.p: Central Washington University began as the Washington State Normal School in 1891. In 1937, the school was rechristened the Central Washington College of Education. In 1961, the school became Central Washington State College and, finally, in 1977, Central Washington University.

accessrestrict.p: Open to the public for educational research

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number]. RG057-06-38, Washington State Normal School Accounting Office, General Property Ledger. Archives and Special Collections, Brooks Library, Central Washington University.
